meanings.definition: A necessary component or element of a whole.
meanings.sent1: The engine is an integrant of the car, without it, the car cannot run.
meanings.sent2: The integrant of the recipe was the secret ingredient that made it so delicious.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle piece was the missing integrant that completed the picture.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the integrant that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: Water is an integrant of life, essential for survival.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that integrates or is integrated into a larger unit.
meanings.sent1: The new student quickly became an integrant of the class, making friends easily.
meanings.sent2: The intern was an integrant of the team, bringing fresh ideas to the project.
meanings.sent3: The stray cat became an unexpected integrant of the household, charming everyone with its antics.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music made him an integrant of the band, adding a unique sound to their performances.
meanings.sent5: The seedling was an integrant of the garden, growing into a beautiful flower.

meanings.definition: Forming an essential part of a whole.
meanings.sent1: The integrant piece completed the jigsaw puzzle, revealing the full picture.
meanings.sent2: Her integrant role in the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent3: The integrant flavor of the dish surprised and delighted the guests.
meanings.sent4: His integrant presence at the meeting brought a sense of unity to the team.
meanings.sent5: The integrant connection between the characters made the story compelling.
